intro: Thapsia dissecta, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Thapsia dissecta produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
